intro: Sunaptea cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
